intro: Tetraria robusta, commonly known as the robust tetraria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Tetraria robusta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
